We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Social Media Manager (NYSC)

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos

About the Role


	Wildfire is looking for a proactive and creative Social Media Manager (Corps Member) to join our growing team. You will work closely with our strategy and creative teams to manage social media pages for clients across multiple industries.
	This role is ideal for a smart, tech-savvy, and passionate Corps Member who is ready to learn fast, execute boldly, and grow within a dynamic environment.


Key Responsibilities


	Manage day-to-day activities of clients&rsquo; social media pages (majorly Instagram &amp; LinkedIn).
	Create, curate, and publish engaging content across platforms.
	Develop monthly content calendars and basic content strategies for different client needs.
	Edit short-form video content using mobile or desktop software.
	Design quick, clean, and visually appealing social media creatives (Canva or similar tools).
	Monitor page performance, track analytics, and suggest improvements.
	Engage with audiences across platforms and respond to comments/messages professionally.
	Collaborate with internal teams (designers, content strategists, developers) to bring campaigns to life.
	Stay updated with social media trends, audio patterns, and new features.
	Implement feedback quickly and continuously improve content quality and performance.


Requirements


	Must be a current NYSC Corps Member serving in Lagos (or about to resume NYSC).
	Strong understanding of social media platforms and their best practices.
	Basic skills in design &amp; video editing (CapCut, Premiere Rush, or similar tools).
	Strong writing and communication skills.
	Ability to plan and execute monthly calendars.
	Ability to manage multiple client accounts simultaneously.
	Highly proactive, eager to learn, and able to work with minimal supervision.
	Open to feedback, team collaboration, and continuous improvement.
	Bonus: Experience with copywriting, content strategy, or community management.


What We&rsquo;re Looking For:


	Someone creative with a natural eye for engaging content.
	Someone who can think fast and adapt quickly.
	Someone who can bring fresh ideas that align with Wildfire&rsquo;s mission: From Ideas to Impact.
	Someone who can represent Wildfire professionally while handling client accounts.


Benefits


	Hands-on agency experience working with real clients.
	Learn content strategy, campaign execution, and brand communication.
	Opportunity to build a strong portfolio for post-NYSC roles.

  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Electrical Engineer",
  "description": "Agbeyewa Farms is a world-class agribusiness with farm operations in Ekiti State, Nigeria. We have foresight for expansion into Africa whilst we create decent jobs and economic opportunities for local communities and become a force to reckon with in the agribusiness on a global scale.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Electrical Engineer&nbsp;

Job Location:&nbsp;Ekiti
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking a talented professional who is passionate about socio-economic development through agricultural and Agro-allied investments.
	Perform regular inspections, maintenance, and repair of all electrical equipment, including processing equipment, conveyor systems, and industrial control panels.
	Quickly diagnose and resolve electrical issues in processing and packaging machinery
	Install new electrical systems and components
	Manage and maintain electrical control panels, PLC systems, and automated machinery in the processing unit.


Qualifications
